introduction.title: The Crow Queen: All Land Bends. All Flesh Kneels.
introduction.tagline: Order is not debated. It is declared.
introduction.description: Once the absolute ruler of Monstru, the Crow Queen—now called the Regent Black—was deposed by a vulgar monster uprising. Stripped of her throne but not her divinity of will, she fled into exile with her Inner Court. In Coffin Canyon, she has found not refuge, but provocation. Here, she consecrates dust into demesne, collars monsters into obedience, and grinds manlings beneath the heel of remembered sovereignty.
introduction.philosophy: Hierarchy is natural, and the Regent Black stands at its apex by undeniable right. Monsters are instruments, humans are livestock, and land exists only to be named, measured, and ruled. Law is the extension of her shadow.
introduction.history: The fall of Monstru shattered the Crow Court but did not erase it. Loyal servants followed their Queen into the Canyon, carrying relics of authority, ledgers of blood-debt, and rites that bind stone and soil to her command. She does not seek to live in the Canyon; she seeks to own it.

core_values: Absolute hierarchy and the divine right of the Queen
The transformation of 'Wild' land into 'Consecrated' territory
The use of ritual and law as physical weapons
Total obedience from both monster and man
The preservation of Monstru's aristocratic traditions
what_they_fight_for: Restoration of the Queen's absolute sovereignty
Expansion of Consecrated Ground across the Canyon
The subjugation of the 'vile' monster uprising
A return to a structured, rigid world order
The collection of blood-debts and ancient tithes
what_they_fight_against: The Monster Rangers' 'befriending' (which she sees as weakness)
The Liberty Corps' lack of proper royal lineage
Any entity that refuses to kneel

reputation.allies_see_them_as: The only source of true stability and civilized law in a dying world
reputation.enemies_see_them_as: Arrogant tyrants and deluded ghosts of a dead empire
reputation.monsters_see_them_as: The 'Collar-Bringers'—the cruelest of all human masters
reputation.the_canyon_sees_them_as: An encroaching shadow of iron and ritual

faction_mechanics.signature_ability_description: The Crow Queen and her court project a field of Consecrated Ground. Within this area, the laws of the Queen are absolute, buffing allies' morale and punishing the 'unlawful' (enemies) with penalties to movement and spirit.
faction_mechanics.playstyle: Territorial dominators. They play a 'castle' style, establishing a zone of control early and forcing the enemy to fight them on ground that has been ritually empowered.
strengths: Unmatched morale control and area denial
High defensive synergy within Consecrated Ground
Strong hero and elite units (Inner Court)
weaknesses: Low mobility outside of their own territory
Fragile if the Queen is eliminated
Expensive units with lower model counts

preferred_states.reason: Ritual power is at its peak and the land itself obeys her.
The Queen respects territory that has a clear, established master.

neutral_states.reason: She understands the dead, though she finds them less useful than living laborers.
Distasteful chaos, but it provides opportunities to impose new laws.

opposed_states.reason: A land without masters is an affront to her very existence.
Feral monsters that refuse to accept the collar.

faction_features.name: The Queen's Law
faction_features.effect: Friendly units within Consecrated Ground gain +1 to Quality checks and ignore the 'Shaken' status.

faction_features.name: Consecration Engine
faction_features.effect: Specific units generate a 12" radius of Consecrated Ground. This terrain type overwrites all other environmental effects for enemies.

units.name: The Regent Black
units.lore: The Crow Queen herself—calm, immaculate, and absolute. She does not fight so much as she corrects reality.
units.tactics: The central anchor of the army. Use her to project Consecrated Ground and keep the 'Ladies' safe while they plant markers.

optional_upgrades.name: Throne of Lies
optional_upgrades.effect: The Regent is always considered to be within Consecrated Ground for her own abilities, regardless of markers.

units.name: The Black Bailiff
units.lore: The Queen’s sentence, made iron. A hulking monstrosity bound in a legal contract of eternal service.
units.tactics: Draw fire and crush morale. Use 'Attention of the Crown' to protect the fragile casters in the court.

optional_upgrades.name: Expanded Gas Reservoirs
optional_upgrades.effect: Mustard Exhalation may be used twice per round.

units.name: The High Executioner
units.lore: The Queen's silent finality. He carries the Royal Ledger—an axe inscribed with the names of every monster that rose up against the throne in Monstru.
units.tactics: A massive pressure piece. Within Consecrated Ground, his Executioner’s Tithe allows him to regain a Quality point whenever he eliminates a model.

optional_upgrades.name: Hood of the Anonymous
optional_upgrades.effect: Gain Stealth while in ruins or shadows.

units.name: The High Huntsman
units.lore: The aristocratic hunter of the Court. He views the monsters of the Canyon not as living beings, but as escaped property to be cataloged and culled.
units.tactics: Ranged harasser. The Queen's Mark grants all friendly units +1 to hit against a specific target within his line of sight.

optional_upgrades.name: The Queen's Arrow
optional_upgrades.effect: High Huntsman gains +2 to hit against a target with The Queen's Mark.

units.name: The Court Jester
units.lore: A twisted performer whose jokes always end in blood. He mocks the freedom of the Canyon dwellers until they descend into a mindless rage.
units.tactics: Disruption specialist. Cruel Jest forces an enemy unit to make a Quality check or be forced to move toward the Jester.

optional_upgrades.name: The King's Humiliation
optional_upgrades.effect: Once per game, the Jester can force an enemy Hero to lose 1 Quality point for one turn.

units.name: The Dark Skald
units.lore: The historian of Monstru's glory. His music vibrates with the weight of thousands of years of tradition.
units.tactics: Support mystic. Use Dirge of the Fallen Empire to force a Morale check on all enemies within 8" of a Consecrated Ground marker.

optional_upgrades.name: Witch-Stitched Silks
optional_upgrades.effect: +1 Defense sewn into the courtly finery.

units.name: Ladies in Waiting
units.lore: Silent court attendants bearing banners and poison. They are the heralds of the Queen's new kingdom.
units.tactics: Expansion. Their main job is placing markers to extend the reach of the Queen's abilities.

optional_upgrades.name: Sweet Cakes
optional_upgrades.effect: Once per game: Remove Shaken within 6"
